    • Constructor Detail

      • CacheManager

        public CacheManager(java.lang.String appName,
                    java.lang.String version)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        appName -
        version - this optional version name will be used to create a version-specific folder within the cache. If this is non-null: then all inactive directories (from previous versions) will be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getCacheDirectory

        public static java.io.File getCacheDirectory(java.lang.String appName)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        This returns or creates a cache directory for your current user. The returned file should exist and have write privileges.
        Parameters:
        appName - this is used as part (or all) of the directory name. For best results this should be a qualified name like "com.apple.GarageBand" instead of simply "GarageBand".
        Returns:
        the cache directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this directory couldn't be initialized correctly.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.String appName,
                              java.lang.String version)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        appName - this is used as part (or all) of the directory name. For best results this should be a qualified name like "com.apple.GarageBand" instead of simply "GarageBand".
        version - a String representing the version of this application. This is used to create a folder (so it should not contain slashes or colons), and it lets us differentiate and clear cached resources when the version changes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • get

        public static CacheManager get()

      • getDirectory

        public java.io.File getDirectory(boolean versioned)
        Parameters:
        versioned - if true then the directory this returns is going to be unique to the version this CacheManager was initialized/constructed with. (So if this was constructed with a null version, this scenario returns a null file.) If false then this directory will be static across versions.
        Returns:
        a directory that should be persistent across sessions. This will not be null (unless you asked for the versioned dir but didn't construct this object with a version), but it may be empty (either the user/system may choose to clear it, or it will be empty the first time the app is run).

      • isInitialized

        public static boolean isInitialized()
        Return true if initialize(String, String) has been called.
        Returns:
        true if initialize(String, String) has been called.

      • uncache

        public static java.lang.Object uncache(java.io.File cachedObject)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Uncache an object previously cached by calling cache(Object, File).
        Parameters:
        cachedObject - the file to uncache.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • cache

        public static void cache(java.lang.Object object,
                         java.io.File dest)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Cache a file using a GZIP compressed ObjectOutputStream.
        Parameters:
        object - a Serializable object to cache.
        dest - the File destination to write to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
